result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Davis Nelson, #367365 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 13CF433, 14CF196 & 14CF314. Defendant Brent Davis Nelson in court with attorney Kathleen Mary Gionis.  Defendant Brent Davis Nelson in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:24 am.  

SENTENCING - 13CF433/14CF196-Exh 1 & Exh 2-O&R.  CT finds elig for SA pgm.  

13CF433-count 1-Order 6 yr WST, 3 yr IC & 3 yr ES, Stay, probation up to 3 yrs.  Conditions-follow orders set forth in 13CV481 & 13CV483-Polk County.  Telephone contact or contact while at the jail - once released at descretion of probation & subj to orders of court w/ Kelly Nelson except as allowed by Probation & Parole.  DNA sample/surcharge.  NO firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, no body armor, cannot hold elected office & other rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation.  9 mo CT starting today, subj to WR no GT.  $290.60 fine/costs thru probation.
